alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 31 at 2:27PM MDT until April 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT LATE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread critical fire weather conditions continue through early evening from the northeast and central highlands to the Oklahoma and Texas borders. Strong northwesterly winds with gusts up to 50 to 65 mph and humidity in the low teens have produced critical fire weather conditions in these areas this afternoon. Saturday will be a quieter day for much of New Mexico. The exception will be across the northeast plains where single-digit humidities should combine with gusty winds, although not as strong as today. The Fire Weather Watch for these areas has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. Stronger westerly wind speeds, warmer temperatures, and minimum humidity falling to the low teens and single-digits are expected again Sunday afternoon through the northeastern and central highlands east to the Oklahoma and Texas border. A Fire Weather Watch is issued for these areas Sunday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT SATURDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Saturday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Sunday morning through Sunday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) until 8 PM today, again Saturday afternoon through early evening, and again late Sunday morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts near 65 mph today. Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph on Saturday afternoon. West winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Sunday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to between 8 to 12 percent this afternoon, Saturday afternoon, and Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
